Functions
CreateSurfaceRevolution
CRefObj<IMesh> CreateSurfaceRevolution(
std::
vector<Vector3> 
&
pts,
uint32 
npts,
uint32 
subdivisions,
float 
maxAngle
)

Generates a solid by revolving the specified polygon around the Y axis. All points are assumed to be relative to the world coordinate origin (thus the point specifies the point's normal vector).

Parameters
pts
std::vector<Vector3>&

List of points (should be increasing Y value)

npts
uint32

Number of points in 'pts'

subdivisions
uint32

Number of subdivisions to generate around the Y axis

maxAngle
float

Maximum number of degrees to rotate around Y axis

Returns

Return newly generated mesh

CreateSphere
CRefObj<IMesh> CreateSphere(
uint32 
subdivisions
)

Creates a mesh in the shape of a sphere.

Parameters
subdivisions
uint32

Number of divisions along azimuth and elevation

Returns

Returns the created mesh

CreateTetrahedron
CRefObj<IMesh> CreateTetrahedron()

Creates a mesh in the shape of a tetrahedron

Returns

Returns the created mesh

CreateGrid
CRefObj<IMesh> CreateGrid(
uint32 
width,
uint32 
height
)

Generates a grid mesh of size -1..+1,-1..+1 with texture coordinates spanning the entire mesh from 0..1

Parameters
width
uint32

number of vertices in X direction

height
uint32

number of vertices in Y direction

Returns

Returns the created mesh

CreateGrid
CRefObj<IMesh> CreateGrid(
uint32 
subdivisions
)

Generates a grid mesh of size -1..+1,-1..+1 with texture coordinates spanning the entire mesh from 0..1

Parameters
subdivisions
uint32

Number of times to subdivide the grid

Returns

Returns the created mesh

CRefObj<IMesh> CreateCube()

Returns a cube mesh

Returns

Returns the newly created mesh object

CreateEmptyMesh
CRefObj<IMesh> CreateEmptyMesh()

Returns an empty mesh

Returns
